result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryan A. Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bryan A. Thompson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bryan A. Thompson was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to sentence in 16CM105.
Credit for 3 days, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Cash bond posted in 16CM105 shall be applied.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Gabbriel P, unless otherwise permitted by the court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

amended assmt report
from 16CM105 per court;  jk/mg
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Catherine Lambrechts.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 1 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 2 - Plea of no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for six months w/conditions.  Probation is consecutive to sentence in 16CM105.  Credit for 3 days served if probation is revoked.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample; written notice provided to defendant.  Cash bond in 16CM105 to apply to costs due.
Scheduling Order

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Xavier Solis (for Atty Catherine Lambrechts).  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved.  Jury status hearing 4/7/16 at 1:00.  Jury trial 4/11/16 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Attys Laura Breckenfelder and Catherine Lambrechts.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Breckenfelder is allowed to withdraw as counsel for def. due to a conflict.  Atty Lambrechts was recently appointed to represet def. and requests time to discuss case with the def.  FPT 1/20/16 at 9:50.  Bond continued.
